Sentencas: The scope of the present work is to study the thermal and chemical compatibility between a Ni-Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 cermet, with 39 vol.% Ni.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: and two electrolytes based on Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 (GDC).
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The cermet was synthesized as a composite NiO-Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 by a polymeric organic complex solution method and subsequently reduced to Ni-Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 cermet.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The GDC electrolytes were prepared by: (a) chemical precipitation process with nitrates as precursors and (NH4)OH as precipitant agent and (b) from a commercial submicronic powder modified with 1.0 wt.% Bi2O3 for improving the sintering mechanism.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The anode was fixed on the electrolyte by isostatic pressing of powders and the obtained sandwich was cosintered between 1350 and 1400 degrees C for 2 It to obtain dense electrolytes with high ionic conductivity along with well-developed anode/electrolyte interfaces of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The cosintered anode/electrolyte interfaces were characterized by using scanning electron microscopy.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The study of the possible diffusion of nickel from the anode into the electrolyte was performed by EDAX analysis.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: The reaction products formed into cosintered materials were determined by X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Sentencas: It is found that the anode is compatible with both electrolytes up to 1400 degrees C without formation of new phases at these temperatures even during prolonged treatments.
Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria

Titulo: Chemical and thermomechanical compatibility between Ni-GDC anode and electrolytes based on ceria
